design_audit.model_formula: lhrp2 ~ unempl + unempl#dummy1 + unempl#dummy2 + unempl#mismatch1w + unempl#dummy1#mismatch1w + unempl#dummy2#mismatch1w + mismatch1w#dummy1 + mismatch1w#dummy2 + mismatch1w + dummy1 + dummy2 + age + agesq + dummy_educ + time + time^2 + time_trend + month | ID + industry#year + occupation_agg#year
design_audit.selection_story: Within-individual wage variation over the business cycle; individual FE absorb time-invariant ability; industry-year and occupation-year FE absorb sector-specific cyclicality

claim_object.treatment_concept: Unemployment rate interacted with job transition dummies and skill mismatch
claim_object.estimand_concept: Wage semi-elasticity to unemployment, and how it varies with job transitions (EE/UE) and skill mismatch
claim_object.target_population: Male workers in NLSY79 (1979-2016), age >= 20, working >= 75 hours per month

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Col4
baseline_specs.notes: Table 2 Col 4 is the main specification with mismatch interactions. Focal parameters are the unempl x transition x mismatch triple interactions.

constraints.functional_form_policy: The interaction structure (unempl x transition x mismatch) is the core model specification. Robustness checks should preserve this triple-interaction structure while varying other controls and definitions.
constraints.sample_note: Sample always restricted to HOURSM >= 75 & age >= 20. Unemployment rate is divided by 100 before regressions.
constraints.regional_unempl_note: When using regional unemployment (rc/data/unemployment/regional_unempl), the code also interacts time_trend with regionfe dummies (c.time_trend#i.regionfe); this is a joint data/controls change.

canonical.notes: Cluster at individual level, matching paper's cluster(ID)

variants.notes: Two-way clustering by individual and year
